messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI auto nodes layout extension?
The purpose of the ComfyUI auto nodes layout extension is to apply a better nodes layout algorithm to ComfyUI workflow, mainly for visualization purposes.
How does the existing 1-click auto-arrange graph in ComfyUI position the nodes?
The existing 1-click auto-arrange graph in ComfyUI positions the nodes according to the level of dependencies using the default 'arrange()' function of LiteGraph.js.
What is the ideal outcome for the ComfyUI auto nodes layout extension?
The ideal outcome for the ComfyUI auto nodes layout extension is to have all wires visible in terms of direction, flow, and connection to nodes.
Which type of graph do most ComfyUI workflows qualify as?
Most ComfyUI workflows can be qualified as directed acyclic graphs (DAGs).
What type of graph drawing algorithm does the ComfyUI auto nodes layout extension focus on?
The ComfyUI auto nodes layout extension focuses on hierarchical graph drawing, which is the most suitable for directed acyclic graphs.
Why is it recommended to remove reroute nodes before applying the auto nodes layout extension?
Reroute nodes mess up ranks/depth in the graph, so it is recommended to remove them before applying the auto nodes layout extension. They can be re-added later if needed.
What is the minimum required ComfyUI version to use the auto nodes layout extension?
To use the auto nodes layout extension, a ComfyUI version later than PR comfyanonymous/ComfyUI#1273 or commit 'bc76b38' is required.
Which graph layout algorithms are implemented in the ComfyUI auto nodes layout extension?
The ComfyUI auto nodes layout extension implements Dagre layout from dagrejs/dagre and ELK 'layered' layout from kieler/elkjs.
